item.title: New theme / mediawiki skin(s) for Kicksecure documentation
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Still looking for good mediawiki skins.

Chameleon - https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Skin:Chameleon

Default Chameleon outlook isn’t breath taking. (Yes, I am allowed to contradict what I might have said a year ago. Either what I saw back then changed (version 1 vs version 2) or my taste changed.)

There is a list of live examples:

https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Skin:Chameleon#Live_examples

One Chameleon customized skin I like is secret-wiki.de.
(I didn’t read actual contents. This is about the skin, layout elements only.)

  • https://secret-wiki.de/wiki/Hauptseite
  • https://secret-wiki.de/wiki/Spezial:Version
  • https://secret-wiki.de/wiki/Gesetz_der_Anziehung
  • https://secret-wiki.de/wiki/Schumann-Resonanzfrequenz

Notes:

  • Probably a bit too much white space left and right for the content but this surely can be fixed.
  • No visible wiki edit elements at all. While I like the page to be content focused it’s good to have edit features accessible in background, in a decent, non-intrusive way.
github.com/ProfessionalWiki/chameleon

How to use a chameleon live example customization in my own wiki?

opened 09:49AM - 19 Dec 20 UTC
adrelanos

Some of the chameleon live examples look great! Let's say I want to modify my local installation of chameleon. How could I...

Also physio-pedia.com has a professionally looking wiki main page:
(I didn’t read actual contents. This is about the skin, layout elements only.)

  • https://www.physio-pedia.com/home/
  • https://www.physio-pedia.com/Volunteer
